intro: Ouratea myrioneura, commonly known as the white sylph, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by dark, leathery fruits containing smooth, oval seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
